types.name: Query
types.description: Type listing all available queries, plugins need to extend this type to add more queries.

args.name: context_id
args.description:
The context's id where editor is being used.
Default to context system if none is provided.

args.name: format
args.description:
The editor's format that is used to get the editor we want.
By default format that is set in user's preference will used if none is given.

args.name: framework
args.description:
Name of the front-end framework we are using.
Only editors supporting this framework will be returned.

args.name: ids
args.description: ids argument is in the form "$identifier, $component" the same as in {{str}} mustache helper

fields.name: totara_comment_comment_cursor
fields.description: A query to load comment's cursor

fields.name: totara_comment_replies
fields.description: Query to load all the replies that are related to the comment.

fields.name: totara_comment_draft_item
fields.description:
Getting the draft reply/comment, which the content can either be a json_encoded document or just
purely text - depends on the text format. This is for preparing the content that being used by
the editor. Furthermore, the content will be run passed by the file system to make sure that all
the files are moved to draft.

fields.name: totara_comment_editor_weka
fields.description:
Since we are allowing the comment's editor to be flexible where it is being used, and the editor is only allow to
be locked down to the component it is used. Which in this case, the editor is locked down to the totara_comment
component. And totara_comment component is being used in different component - therefore we are going to fetch
the extensions for editor weka that the parent component want the editor to be. Then we will mask it with
the totara_comment component.

This query had been deprecated and the behaviour of the query had been changed.
Please use query editor_weka_editor instead.

args.name: component
args.description: The component of place where the comment's weka editor is being used.

args.name: area
args.description: The area of place where the comment's weka editor is being used.

args.name: comment_area
args.description: This is to identify whether it is for comment or reply.

args.name: id
args.description:
This parameter is deprecated. Do not use this input field, use query totara_comment_editor_weka_from_id instead
@deprecated

args.name: instance_id
args.description: The instance's id of which that is using the comment component.

args.name: draft_id
args.description: Draft item id needed for draft files

fields.name: totara_comment_editor_weka_from_id
fields.description:
This query will behave similar to query totara_comment_editor_weka. However, this query is fetching based
on either comment's id or reply's id as they are from the same table.

This query had been deprecated and the behaviour had been changed.
Please use query editor_weka_editor instead.

args.name: id
args.description: Either comment's id or reply's id.

args.name: comment_area
args.description: This is to identify whether it is for comment or reply.

args.name: draft_id
args.description: Draft item id needed for draft files

fields.name: totara_notification_event_resolvers
fields.description:
A query to fetch all the notifiable event resolvers within the system, and it is up to the
implementation of persist query to include the associated notification preferences
with the query or not.

args.name: extended_context
args.description:
Extended context MUST be provided, in order to create the notification preference
within that context. Note that the context's id for this extended_context can be fallback
to the context system if none is provided.

fields.name: totara_notification_notification_preferences
fields.description:
A query to fetch all the notification preferences under specific context which
can be listening to the notifiable event (if provided).

args.name: extended_context
args.description:
Extended context MUST be provided, in order to create the notification preference
within that context. Note that the context's id for this extended_context can be fallback
to the context system if none is provided.

args.name: resolver_class_name
args.description:
If this parameter is provided, we are fetching only the notification preferences that are listening to
this event only.

args.name: at_context_only
args.description:
Whether we want the list of notification preferences at the specific context only,
or the list that is a mix of overridden and non-overridden (higher context).

fields.name: container_workspace_discussions
fields.description: Query to fetch all the discussions within a workspace

args.name: workspace_id
args.description: The workspace's id where we are looking for discussions.

args.name: sort
args.description:
Sort option for the workspace discussions, however, it will not be applied when we are
fetching the pinned discussions

args.name: search_term
args.description: The word that is existing within the discussion content.

args.name: pinned
args.description:
If pinned is not given, then this query will look for all the pinned and not pinned
post discussions.

args.name: cursor
args.description:
Fetching the discussions depending on the cursor. If cursor is not being set, then we are
going to start from scratch. Which is page 1

fields.name: container_workspace_discussion_cursor
fields.description: Query to fetch the next cursor for the discussions

args.name: cursor
args.description:

types.name: mod_perform_track
types.description:
A specific track

Tracks are containers within activities that store assignment groups and scheduling information.
Currently activities always have exactly 1 track but in future we may support multiple tracks within the same activity.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional track description. Not currently used in interface.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the track, e.g. ACTIVE, PAUSED

fields.name: schedule_is_open
fields.description: True if the schedule is open ended (start date only), false for limited scheduling (start and end date)

fields.name: schedule_is_fixed
fields.description:
True if schedule is using fixed dates (admin specifies an actual date), false
for relative scheduling (dates calculated relative to events)

fields.name: schedule_fixed_from
fields.description: Start of scheduling period for fixed dates

fields.name: schedule_fixed_to
fields.description: End of scheduling period for limited scheduling with fixed dates

fields.name: schedule_dynamic_from
fields.description: Offset from trigger for start of scheduling period with relative dates

fields.name: schedule_dynamic_to
fields.description: Offset from trigger for end of scheduling period for limited scheduling with relative dates

fields.name: schedule_dynamic_source
fields.description: Source of trigger for relative scheduling

fields.name: schedule_use_anniversary
fields.description:
If true, if user's calculated start date is in the past on assignment, use the
next anniversary of the reference date instead of the actual reference date

fields.name: due_date_is_enabled
fields.description: True if due date options should be enabled for this track

fields.name: due_date_is_fixed
fields.description: True if scheduling is using fixed dates

fields.name: due_date_fixed
fields.description: Value for fixed due date

fields.name: due_date_offset
fields.description: Offset from trigger (currently only option is 'time since creation of instance') for relative due date

fields.name: repeating_is_enabled
fields.description: True if repeating should be enabled for this track

fields.name: repeating_type
fields.description: Trigger for repeat instance creation

fields.name: repeating_offset
fields.description: Offset from trigger for repeat instance creation

fields.name: repeating_is_limited
fields.description:
If true number of repeating instances that will be created will be limited to
a specific number. Otherwise no limit is used

fields.name: repeating_limit
fields.description: Number of subject instances that will be created for this user assignment, if repeating_is_limited is enabled

fields.name: assignments
fields.description: List of assignments attached to this track

fields.name: can_assign_positions
fields.description: Whether viewing user has permission to assign positions

fields.name: can_assign_organisations
fields.description: Whether viewing user has permission to assign organisations

types.name: mod_perform_track_subject_instance_generation_enums
types.description: A list of possible job behaviours for subject instance generation which a track can be set to

enumValues.name: ONE_PER_SUBJECT
enumValues.description:
When selected one subject instance will be created for each matching user.
The subject instance will refer to the user as a whole rather than any particular job.

enumValues.name: ONE_PER_JOB
enumValues.description:
When selected one subject instance will be created for each job assignment of each matching user.
The subject instance will refer to the specific job assignment as being the topic of the activity.

types.name: mod_perform_participant_section_progress_status
types.description: A list of possible progress status states that a user participant section can be in

enumValues.name: COMPLETE
enumValues.description: The section has been submitted

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: The section has been viewed or draft answers have been saved but is not yet been submitted

enumValues.name: NOT_STARTED
enumValues.description: The section has never been viewed by the participant

enumValues.name: NOT_SUBMITTED
enumValues.description: The section has been manually closed without it being completed by the participant

enumValues.name: PROGRESS_NOT_APPLICABLE
enumValues.description: The participant's progress on this activity is not relevant (for example it is view-only so they have no progress to make)

types.name: mod_perform_participant_section_availability_status
types.description: A list of possible availability status states that a user participant section can be in

enumValues.name: OPEN
enumValues.description: The section is open so can be responded to by the participant

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: The section is closed meaning it can't be responded to by the participant

enumValues.name: AVAILABILITY_NOT_APPLICABLE
enumValues.description:
The section availability is not relevant for this participant, perhaps because
the participant has a view-only relationship

args.name: component
args.description:
The component where the editor weka is used.
Deprecated in favour of usage_identifier.

args.name: area
args.description:
The specific area within the component where the editor weka is used.
Deprecated in favour of usage_identifier.

args.name: variant_name
args.description:
Optional parameter to get the extensions. When the argument is passed, then it will
superceed the component/area to get the list of extension. Otherwise, by default the
list of extensions can be found by component/area

args.name: usage_identifier
args.description:
The parameter to pass down to the variant, as it can be treated as
extra data.

args.name: extra_extensions

fields.name: showtoolbar
fields.description: To tell whether we are displaying toolbar or not.
fields.deprecationReason: The showtoolbar field had been deprecated and no longer needed

fields.name: repository_data
fields.description: The upload repository data
fields.deprecationReason: The repository_data is now fetched from query editor_weka_repository_data

fields.name: context_id
fields.description:
The context's id where the editor is being used. This has to be done as part of constructing
editor, most likely it can be context_system, if the component that is using editor is not providing one.

fields.name: files
fields.description: The current files within weka editor. If there are any.

args.name: component
args.description:
The component where the files are living.
By default, this will be 'user'

args.name: file_area
args.description:
The file area which identify the place within the component.
By default, the value for this key will be 'draft'

args.name: item_id
args.description: The item's id - which should be the file draft id id.

fields.deprecationReason: The files field got deprecated in favour of query editor_weka_draft_file

fields.name: draft_files
fields.description: The current draft files within weka editor. If there are any.

args.name: draft_item_id
args.description: The id of the draft area

fields.deprecationReason: The files field got deprecated in favour of query editor_weka_draft_file

fields.name: options
fields.description: Options is an json_encoded string, this string should be decoded in the front-end and pass it to extension itself.

fields.name: max_bytes
fields.description:
A numeric string that represent for bytes. We are using string instead of
integer for this one because, graphql Integer does not support up to 64-bit integers but only 32-bit integers.

fields.name: media_type
fields.description: If media_type is null, then this file is not a part of any embbedded-able media files.

types.name: totara_competency_assignment
types.description:
Competency assignment - a relationship between a specific competency and a group of users who are assigned to it.

NOTE: The query is responsible for ensuring the user can see the assignment.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Assignment type (one of 'admin', 'self', 'system' or 'other')

fields.name: type_name
fields.description:
Human readable label for the type. NOTE: These do not map directly to the
assignment type, some types return more specific strings based on group type

fields.name: competency_id
fields.description: ID of the competency being assigned

fields.name: user_group_type
fields.description: Type of group being assigned (one of 'user', 'position', 'organisation' or 'cohort')

fields.name: user_group_id
fields.description: ID of group instance being assigned

fields.name: optional
fields.description: True if the assignment is optional (rather than mandatory)

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Assignment status code matching one of the totara_competency\entity\assignment
STATUS_ constants (e.g. 0 => 'draft', 1 => 'active', 2 => 'archived')

fields.name: created_by
fields.description: ID of user who created this assignment

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Time of assignment record creation

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: Time of last modification to the assignment record

fields.name: archived_at
fields.description: Time the assignment was archived - not set if not yet archived

fields.name: competency
fields.description: The competency object this assignment relates to

fields.name: user_group
fields.description: The user group object this assignment relates to

fields.name: progress_name
fields.description:
Human readable name which includes the actual group name for position, organisation and cohorts.
For self, other and system assignments it will return a fixed string

fields.name: reason_assigned
fields.description:
Gets human readable reason for assignment, we show:
- the fullname of the assigner and role
- a fixed string for self and other
- the actual name of the user group + type for position, organisation and audience

fields.name: assigner
fields.description: User object for the user doing the assigning

fields.name: can_archive
fields.description: True if current user is permitted to archive this assignment

fields.name: assignment_specific_scale
fields.description:
The scale for the associated competency, with proficient flags on the values adjusted
if there is an assignment specific min proficient value override.

fields.name: is_assigned
fields.description: Whether the user is currently assigned

fields.name: unassigned_at
fields.description: If the user is not assigned then this returns the date the user got unassigned last

fields.name: fullname
fields.description: Competency fullname

fields.name: idnumber
fields.description: Competency idnumber

fields.name: shortname
fields.description: Competency shortname

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: Display name is a unified display name that can be used across different types of hierarchy item. Equivalent to fullname

fields.name: description
fields.description: Human readable rich-text description of this competency

fields.name: timecreated
fields.description: Time of competency creation

fields.name: timemodified
fields.description: Time when this competency record was last modified

fields.name: frameworkid
fields.description: ID of framework that this competency belongs to

fields.name: framework
fields.description: Framework that this competency belongs to

fields.name: path
fields.description: Slash separated list of ancestors of this competency including the competency's own ID. E.g. '/1/2/6/18'

fields.name: visible
fields.description: True if the competency is set to be visible

fields.name: parentid
fields.description: ID of this competency's parent

fields.name: parent
fields.description: Competency that this competency is a child of, or null for top level competency

fields.name: children
fields.description: List of competencies that are direct children of this competency

fields.name: typeid
fields.description: ID of this competency's type

fields.description: Type object for this competency's type

fields.name: assignments
fields.description: List of assignments related to this competency (groups of users assigned to it)

fields.name: assign_availability
fields.description: Array of integers representing ways the competency can be assigned (1 = assign to self, 2 = assign to others)

types.name: ID
types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Whether the self completion is set for this very content marketplace or not, by checking the field
"completion" (or completion_tracking constants) of course module table.

If this field is TRUE then the field "completion_condition" MUST be set to NULL, otherwise
there would be a serious violation of data integrity.

resolved as a part of core_course_module type.

+ NULL - as user had not yet started.

completion as completed.

enumValues.description: Whether marking the completion base on the condition from content marketplace provider.

fields.name: core_file_unused_draft_item_id
fields.description:
A mutation to fetch the unused draft item id.
This is mutation because, if it is a query, apollo-client will try to squeeze
the multiple requests into one - as they are identical to each other.
Hence, mutation will be better because it will assure that each of query within multiple
instnaces to be executed.

Note that: `fetchPolicy: 'no-cache'` does not help at all.

types.description: Input parameters required for open-ended track schedule period using fixed dates

inputFields.name: schedule_is_open
inputFields.description: True if the schedule is open ended (start date only), false for limited scheduling (start and end date)

inputFields.name: schedule_is_fixed
inputFields.description:
True if schedule is using fixed dates (admin specifies an actual date), false
for relative scheduling (dates calculated relative to events)

inputFields.name: schedule_fixed_from
inputFields.description: Start of scheduling period for fixed dates

inputFields.name: schedule_fixed_to
inputFields.description: End of scheduling period for limited scheduling with fixed dates

inputFields.name: schedule_dynamic_from
inputFields.description: Offset from trigger for start of scheduling period with relative dates

inputFields.name: schedule_dynamic_to
inputFields.description: Offset from trigger for end of scheduling period for limited scheduling with relative dates

inputFields.name: schedule_dynamic_source
inputFields.description: Source of trigger for relative scheduling

inputFields.name: schedule_use_anniversary
inputFields.description:
If true, if user's calculated start date is in the past on assignment, use the
next anniversary of the reference date instead of the actual reference date

inputFields.name: due_date_is_enabled
inputFields.description: True if due date options should be enabled for this track

inputFields.name: due_date_is_fixed
inputFields.description: True if scheduling is using fixed dates

inputFields.name: due_date_fixed
inputFields.description: Value for fixed due date

inputFields.name: due_date_offset
inputFields.description: Offset from trigger (currently only option is 'time since creation of instance') for relative due date

inputFields.name: repeating_is_enabled
inputFields.description: True if repeating should be enabled for this track

inputFields.name: repeating_type
inputFields.description: Trigger for repeat instance creation

inputFields.name: repeating_offset
inputFields.description: Offset from trigger for repeat instance creation

inputFields.name: repeating_is_limited
inputFields.description:
If true number of repeating instances that will be created will be limited to
a specific number. Otherwise no limit is used

inputFields.name: repeating_limit
inputFields.description: Number of subject instances that will be created for this user assignment, if repeating_is_limited is enabled

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
